page.title: 04CHANGING TIMES IN CAUNTON
page.content: The group interviewed one of the oldest residents in the area,84 year old{Mr.Joe Beckett. Mr.Beckett came to the area as a three year old when his father left his job as a bargee on the River Trent and became employed by Major Hole as a woodman. At school he was in a large class and his teacher was Mrs.Gilbert.At the age of 11 he was exempted from school to work at Church Farm. He had to get up at 6.30am and work till 5.30pm,7 days a week. His next job was as a plough boy working with and caring for the horses on Boddy's Farm. He earned 2 shillings a week which he described as good money. As a young man he lost many friends in the First W orld War,though he was too young to join the army.
